info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 28 at 1:41PM CDT until March 28 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR BREEZY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR PART OF NORTHERN TEXAS... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TUESDAY TO 1 AM CDT WEDNESDAY FOR BREEZY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR PART OF NORTHERN TEXAS... The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * TIMING...For Monday, until early this evening. For Tuesday, from noon until 1 AM Wednesday. * WINDS...For Monday, south 15 to 25 mph with gusts to 30 mph. For Tuesday, 20 to 30 mph with gusts to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...For Monday, as low as 14 percent. For Tuesday as low as 19 percent. * MAXIMUM TEMPERATURES...For Monday, 90 to 92 degrees. For Tuesday, 86 to 89 degrees.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures will contribute to extreme fire behavior.
